question: A) What does volumetric water content ($\theta$) represent in unsaturated soils? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Volumetric water content quantifies the water volume per unit soil volume.
error: ❌ Not quite. $\theta$ is the volumetric ratio of water to total soil volume.

question: A) Which statements about residual water content ($\theta_r$) are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Yes! $\theta_r$ reflects tightly held, immobile water and depends on soil microstructure.
error: ❌ Not quite. Residual water content is immobile and below the plant-available range.

question: A) What defines the permanent wilting point (PWP)? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. PWP is a soil suction threshold that limits plant uptake.
error: ❌ Review the concept — PWP is where plants permanently wilt due to unavailability of water.

question: A) Which of the following statements about field capacity (FC) are true? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Well done. FC is the post-drainage condition just before water becomes unavailable.
error: ❌ Not quite. FC is not saturation — it's the drained, plant-available upper limit.
